rules.natural: If a paper was accepted by a journal, then provided that a project was funded by a grant, either data was analyzed using software or samples were collected in the field.
Provided that a study was replicated in a lab, results were validated by a methodology.
Provided that results were validated by a methodology, findings were confirmed through a review.
If a model was developed by a researcher, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.
Either a model was developed by a researcher, or a simulation was created by a team.
Either a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, or an effect was measured with an instrument.
Provided that a researcher published in a journal, a cure was discovered for a disease.
If an effect was measured with an instrument, then samples were collected in the field.
Whenever data was recorded by a sensor, data was analyzed using software.
Provided that data was transmitted via a platform, data was recorded by a sensor.
Either a tool was designed by an engineer, or a device was built by a technician.
If a device was built by a technician, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.
Whenever a device was approved by a regulator, a prototype was tested in a lab.
If results were shared in a database, then provided that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.
Provided that a researcher presented at a conference, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.
If a team collaborated with an institution, then given that a study was replicated in a lab, whenever a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

Provided that researchers partnered with an organization, if a study was replicated in a lab, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.
If a project was coordinated by a director, then a team collaborated with an institution.
Either a project was coordinated by a director, or a team was managed by a leader.
Provided that a team was managed by a leader, researchers partnered with an organization.
If data was analyzed using software, then an invention was patented by an agency.
Provided that samples were collected in the field, either a researcher published in a journal or a researcher presented at a conference.
Whenever a paper was submitted to a journal, it was peer-reviewed by experts.
Either a paper was submitted to a journal, or it was accepted by a journal.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(confirmed(findings, review) -> (verified(hypothesis, experiment) -> breakthrough(discovery, field))) -> retracted(paper, journal))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that whenever findings were confirmed through a review, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field, then a paper was retracted by a journal.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(created(simulation, team) -> (patented(invention, agency) | (published(researcher, journal) | presented(researcher, conference)))) -> abandoned(project, institution))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that provided that a simulation was created by a team, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference, then a project was abandoned by an institution.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(monitored(system, satellite) -> (observed(phenomenon, telescope) -> transmitted(data, platform))) -> failed(transmission, network))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that if a system was monitored by a satellite, then given that a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, data was transmitted via a platform, then a transmission failed over a network.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(designed(tool, engineer) -> (patented(invention, agency) | (published(researcher, journal) | presented(researcher, conference)))) -> approved(device, regulator))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that if a tool was designed by an engineer, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference, then a device was approved by a regulator.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(designed(tool, engineer) -> (patented(invention, agency) | (published(researcher, journal) | presented(researcher, conference)))) -> -tested(prototype, lab))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that provided that a tool was designed by an engineer, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference, then it is not the case that a prototype was tested in a lab.
If results were not shared in a database, then access to data was restricted.
If results were not shared in a database, then it is not the case that access to data was restricted.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either a cure was discovered for a disease, or a breakthrough discovery occurred in a field.

(A10 → (A7 → (A5 ∨ A6))).natural: If a paper was accepted by a journal, then provided that a project was funded by a grant, either data was analyzed using software or samples were collected in the field.

(A11 → G).natural: Whenever a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A12 → (A11 → G)).natural: If a study was replicated in a lab, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A12 → A13).natural: Provided that a study was replicated in a lab, results were validated by a methodology.

(A13 → (A11 → G)).natural: If results were validated by a methodology, then whenever a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A13 → A14).natural: Provided that results were validated by a methodology, findings were confirmed through a review.

(A14 → (A11 → G)).natural: If findings were confirmed through a review, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A16 → (A4 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3))).natural: If a model was developed by a researcher, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either a model was developed by a researcher, or a simulation was created by a team.

(A17 → (A4 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3))).natural: Provided that a simulation was created by a team, either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A19 → A21).natural: If a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, then data was recorded by a sensor.

(A19 → A22).natural: Whenever a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, data was transmitted via a platform.

(A19 → A5).natural: If a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, then data was analyzed using software.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Either a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, or an effect was measured with an instrument.

(A2 → A1).natural: Provided that a researcher published in a journal, a cure was discovered for a disease.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: Either a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A20 → A6).natural: If an effect was measured with an instrument, then samples were collected in the field.

(A21 → A5).natural: Whenever data was recorded by a sensor, data was analyzed using software.

(A22 → A21).natural: Provided that data was transmitted via a platform, data was recorded by a sensor.

(A23 → (A19 → A22)).natural: If a system was monitored by a satellite, then given that a phenomenon was observed with a telescope, data was transmitted via a platform.

(A25 → (A4 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3))).natural: Provided that a tool was designed by an engineer, either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A25 ∨ A26).natural: Either a tool was designed by an engineer, or a device was built by a technician.

(A26 → (A4 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3))).natural: If a device was built by a technician, then either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A28 → A27).natural: Whenever a device was approved by a regulator, a prototype was tested in a lab.

(A29 → (A11 → G)).natural: If results were shared in a database, then provided that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A3 → G).natural: Provided that a researcher presented at a conference, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A31 → (A12 → (A11 → G))).natural: If a team collaborated with an institution, then given that a study was replicated in a lab, whenever a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A31 ∨ A32).natural: Either a team collaborated with an institution, or researchers partnered with an organization.

(A32 → (A12 → (A11 → G))).natural: Provided that researchers partnered with an organization, if a study was replicated in a lab, then given that a hypothesis was verified through an experiment, a breakthrough discovery occurs in a field.

(A33 → A31).natural: If a project was coordinated by a director, then a team collaborated with an institution.

(A33 ∨ A34).natural: Either a project was coordinated by a director, or a team was managed by a leader.

(A34 → A32).natural: Provided that a team was managed by a leader, researchers partnered with an organization.

(A4 ∨ (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Either an invention was patented by an agency, or a researcher published in a journal, or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A5 → A4).natural: If data was analyzed using software, then an invention was patented by an agency.

(A5 ∨ A6).natural: Either data was analyzed using software, or samples were collected in the field.

(A6 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Provided that samples were collected in the field, either a researcher published in a journal or a researcher presented at a conference.

(A7 → (A5 ∨ A6)).natural: If a project was funded by a grant, then either data was analyzed using software or samples were collected in the field.

(A8 ∨ (A7 → (A5 ∨ A6))).natural: Either a paper was peer-reviewed by experts, or if a project was funded by a grant, then either data was analyzed using software or samples were collected in the field.

(A9 → A8).natural: Whenever a paper was submitted to a journal, it was peer-reviewed by experts.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: Either a paper was submitted to a journal, or it was accepted by a journal.

(¬A29 → A30).natural: If results were not shared in a database, then access to data was restricted.

(¬A29 → ¬A30).natural: If results were not shared in a database, then it is not the case that access to data was restricted.
